channel.title: Project Insanity Compilers
channel.description: Hi, I'm very new to coding in general, and I am unable to get my compilers working for PI no matter what I do. I will start with the client compiler. This was the default code: [code]@echo off title Client - Compiler javac -d bin -sourcepath src pause [/code] However I messed up my classpaths/paths so I changed it to this: [code]@echo off title Client - Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_25\bin\javac" -d bin -sourcepath src pause [/code] This registers the javac command but now gives me this error: [code]javac: no source files Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .[/code] I am very new to this and any help would be appreciated, I've been trying to get this going for hours and it is just frustrating me more and more :( Windows 7 64-Bit, latest Java JRE and JDK installed

item.title: Project Insanity Compilers
item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

Try this
@echo off
Title Compiler
echo Compiling…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_25\bin\javac.exe” -d ./Class/ Java/.java Java/sign/.java
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Project Insanity Compilers
item.dc:creator: @lemonturtle76 lemonturtle76
item.description:
@lemonturtle76 wrote:

Hi, I’m very new to coding in general, and I am unable to get my compilers working for PI no matter what I do.
I will start with the client compiler. This was the default code:

@echo off title Client - Compiler javac -d bin -sourcepath src pause
However I messed up my classpaths/paths so I changed it to this:

@echo off title Client - Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_25\bin\javac" -d bin -sourcepath src pause
This registers the javac command but now gives me this error:

javac: no source files Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .
I am very new to this and any help would be appreciated, I’ve been trying to get this going for hours and it is just frustrating me more and more
Windows 7 64-Bit, latest Java JRE and JDK installed

Read full topic
